definition: to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot

sentences.english: Though she could be just another victim of the disorienting photography.
sentences.chinese: 不過她可能也被讓人迷惑的攝影給糟踏了。

sentences.english: Don't waste such a golden opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 不要糟踏這樣一個千載一時的機會。

sentences.english: He murdered the song By poor singing.
sentences.chinese: 他唱得很糟，糟踏了這支歌曲。

sentences.english: Now I need you, despite the fact, that you've killed all my plants.
sentences.chinese: 此時，我需要你，儘管你糟踏了我所有的花草。

sentences.english: Experience tends to show that extended explanations can ruin a good game.
sentences.chinese: 經驗往往顯示，解釋太多會把不錯的遊戲給糟踏掉。

sentences.english: She had several calls to make and therefore could not risk a disarrangement of her person.
sentences.chinese: 她要去拜訪幾戶人家，因而不敢冒險糟踏自己的風度。

definition: to waste/to defile/to abuse/to insult/to defile/to trample on/to wreck/also pr. [zao1 ta5]
to waste/to spoil/to destroy/to insult grievously
to ill-use/to humiliate/to degrade/to ruin/also pr. [zuo2 jian4]
fornication and insults/to rape and insult
to waste natural resources recklessly/not to know how to use things sparingly
worse than a dog or pig/lower than low
